headline: US software stocks tumble sparks concerns that AI trade is reshaping markets
summary: The software and services industry's recent plunge has ignited fears that the artificial intelligence boom may be reshaping markets in unexpected ways, raising questions about whether a rotation out of technology stocks signals trouble ahead for ​the AI trade.  Financial markets, juiced for months with investor enthusiasm about the artificial intelligence trade, got a rude awakening last week as software stocks around ‌the globe sank on worries that fast-advancing AI tools could upend the industry.  While a rebound in the broader market helped soothe nerves on Friday, the outlook for U.S. software stocks, at the epicenter of the ‌selloff, remained murky.

content.title: US software stocks tumble sparks concerns that AI trade is reshaping markets

While a rebound in the broader market helped soothe nerves on Friday, the outlook for U.S. software stocks, at the epicenter of the ‌selloff, remained murky.

headline: AppLovin Roars Back: Analyst Calls the Dip a Must-Buy — But Is It?
summary: AppLovin (NASDAQ:APP) has been on quite a rollercoaster following a scathing report from short-seller CapitalWatch that accused the company of basically serving as a “digital laundromat” for Asian crime groups and claimed AppLovin’s ad tools were helping launder billions through shady networks. The stock was already slipping thanks to general market jitters and growing competition, ... AppLovin Roars Back: Analyst Calls the Dip a Must-Buy — But Is It?

headline: Here's Why AppLovin (APP) Could be Great Choice for a Bottom Fisher
summary: After losing some value lately, a hammer chart pattern has been formed for AppLovin (APP), indicating that the stock has found support. This, combined with an upward trend in earnings estimate revisions, could lead to a trend reversal for the stock in the near term.

headline: Workday CEO shift, AppLovin stock surges on short-seller apology
summary: Market Domination host Josh Lipton takes a look at some of Monday's trending tickers and stories. Cleveland-Cliffs (CLF) stock is plunging after the company's fourth quarter earnings results disappointed investors. Workday (WDAY) announced that co-founder Aneel Bhusri will return as CEO. AppLovin (APP) stock is surging after CapitalWatch retracted claims that the company was engaging in money laundering. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.title: Workday CEO shift, AppLovin stock surges on short-seller apology

Market Domination host Josh Lipton takes a look at some of Monday's trending tickers and stories.

Cleveland-Cliffs (CLF) stock is plunging after the company's fourth quarter earnings results disappointed investors.

Workday (WDAY) announced that co-founder Aneel Bhusri will return as CEO.

AppLovin (APP) stock is surging after CapitalWatch retracted claims that the company was engaging in money laundering.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.
